page.title: 11WHITE HALL CENTRE
page.content: White Hall is a 19th Century manor house standing in wooded grounds thirteen hundred feet above sea level on the ridge between the Goyt Valley and Chapel-en-le-frith.It is easily reached by road,the main drive leaving the A.5002 three miles north of Buxton. Opened by Derbyshire Education Committee in 1950 White Hall Centre for Open Country Pursuits provides a wide range of courses for school parties,students,teachers and private individuals.Using a highly pressuried National Park,White Hall has a responsibility to ensure that those who attend a course,are made aware of the delicacy of the environment as well as the requirements of other users,workers and recreationalists alike.
